Hello beautiful people!
8 years ago I graduated from the University of Alberta with a degree in honors genetics  At the time I was expected to begin medical school, but I was disillusioned and upset at the little attention that was paid to what we call the placebo  Furthermore, it was difficult to see how any real evidence could be found when the modern medical establishment knows so little about consciousness itself  During my last couple years of my 5 year degree, I could only find a few researchers who were genuinely tackling the problem, and found my higher level genetics professors stumped when I asked questions that reached into the holes at the foundations of modern biology and medical research  There are so many anomalies simply being ignored because they do not fit into the current medical paradigm of reality  These anomalies cause discomfort within the minds of these researchers and doctors, who choose to ignore the science and continue on as though nothing happened, but science is about the pursuit of truth no matter where it takes you
The last 8 years have led me to every corner of the planet to study with Yogis, Monks, Shamans of the amazon, and to unique and cutting edge research labs all over the States, Canada, and Europe  What I found is a growing body of evidence to show how powerful our minds are when it comes to the manifestation of a strong healthy body, and an increasing number of researchers tackling the question of the placebo in honest, open minded ways  What I also discovered was the huge body of evidence uncovered by physicists over the last 100 years  None of it was taught in any biology classes, which is why modern medical research hasn't the slightest clue about what consciousness really might be  These physicists were never looking for answers to the consciousness riddle, they were trying to uncover the basic workings of the universe, but as a by-product of their curiosity, they have shown us an incredible amount concerning the question of consciousness  Finally a couple years ago, the BBC documentary 'What is Reality' was the first mainstream documentary to attempt to explain to us that it is impossible to understand reality without understanding the role consciousness plays in its creation, and that you are now an outsider in the world of physics if you deny that consciousness has an effect on the physical universe  Nowhere is that more important than with our bodies  We cannot accept the placebo without accepting that the placebo is actually in effect 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and that more than anything, our expectations and outlooks for our current and future state of health are what drives the wellness or sickness of our being
In order to complement my scientific understanding of what is happening between our mind and body, I have studied the mind through psychotherapy, hypnotherapy, NLP, the teachings of Buddhism, and I have trained to teach Yoga and meditation  This workshop is not only about sharing the framework of the new health paradigm coming from science, but to help with the understanding of what we can do to change the beliefs and paradigms we hold in our unconscious  Yoga is not simply a tool to maintain the fitness of the body, as is commonly believed in our western world, but it is a tool to help with mental stress and the creation of positivism  So many of us are stuck in habitual negative mental thought patterns, but there are so many ways to overcome this and take control of our own happiness  Happiness is something that comes from within, from our paradigms and beliefs about the world, and in actuality has nothing to do with outside circumstances, but to the way we react to those circumstances  Through this workshop I try to empower people with not only a framework of knowledge but with some basic tools like visualization meditations to help create this positive state of health  Even at the National Institute of Health, the medical 'old boys' institution in Washington DC, research is coming out weekly to show that we have the power to very specifically up-regulate hormone production or immune response in our bodies through visualization techniques, meditation, and specific yogic asanas 
For the last 2 years, I have been travelling through Australia  I am about to be purchasing a few hundred acres of land in the north okanagan with some friends to start a sustainable farming project with a permaculture and yoga school  Most of Australia, was actually about courses and wwoofing, but I was inspired by the festival scene there  I was enjoying festivals, but felt a desire to give back a little more to the experience  Some friends convinced me I should start hosting workshops, and over the past 2 years I have done over 20 workshops and the workshop has evolved with every experience
I have learned that the most effective way to share this understanding is to lead the workshop as a guided group discussion  I have the framework, the knowledge, and the depth of examples and experiences to share that I could speak for hours in front of a group, but with something so sensitive that every one of us has so much personal experience and perspective on, Ive found that encouraging as much discussion and sharing from the group is a far more effective way to get the point across  That being said, Ive learned several techniques which have helped me maintain order in a discussion that can bring up so many emotions
At the moment I am very busy starting a community futures small business program to help me avoid any mistakes with this big project, and searching for property  I am however happy to answer any questions you might have  I still dont have a website, although a friend is helping me slowly build one, and there is no formal presentation or powerpoint I can send you  
If you have a projector, it would help me get a few points across with short videos I have on my computer, but those are not necessary either  At the festivals in Australia, I was generally given an hour and half or two hours, although I spoke to several communities where the discussion  reached almost four hours  2 hours is more than enough though  Ive done the workshop on beaches, under festival tents, and in large rooms, so the location doesn't really matter, what matters most is the intimacy and a space where we can be uninterrupted for the time of the workshop  
I understand that this letter is coming a bit late, but there is no problem for me to join you guys if you have a bit of space you want filled up  The subject of the workshop is unique and has always excited people, and the main purpose I have in sharing is to empower people to understand the mind body connection so that they can live a healthy life  It has been 4 years since the last time I was sick, and this is something I am hoping to help others realize is possible
Thanks, and Im looking forward to hearing back from you
Chris Pisesky

bio:
Hello,
  My name is Drew Rouse I have taught Bikram advanced and beginners yoga for 12 years I have my own series called "Jedi Yoga" as well My focus is on thoracic and hip opening and balancing strength and flexibility I helped to teach Bikram teachers for 5 years I have have taught Therapeutic Flying workshops Partner Stretching, a restorative version of "Acroyoga" for 10 years I have taught thousands of students, workshops, retreats, seminars and classes all over North America and Europe and have consulted on many of the newer methods of yoga that are now common

I am a horse based educator who runs a practice out in Squamish Valley called Mountain Horse School I offer riding lessons, special needs sessions, workshops and one on-one-coaching that integrate the learning and transformation that becomes possible when we come into relationship with horses Horses are an embodiment of grounded power and mindfulness By working with them consciously, we drop into the realm of myth and ceremony- activating intuition, authenticity, true leadership, and heart/brain coherence 

Over the years I've taken some of the concepts I've learned through the work with the horses and transmuted them into other offerings that can happen without the presence of the animals themselves One such offering is called 'Dreamride', a 15 hr somatic ceremony/workshop where participants explore Mary Oliver's famous question: "Tell me, what it is you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?"

Dreamride is about dreaming and stalking our right wild lives; the ones where we can offer ourselves and our gifts as food to the world It harnesses the power and transformative potential of horse energy as we will ask for a herd of horses to carry us through a guided shamanic and somatic journey where we will ask for our dream to be revealed to us, and ask for a trail for us to follow to make it real in the world

Luminosity Flow: A Journey Through the Body

Short description: 
Punctuate your festival by stretching sore dancing muscles and re-centering the mindThis class will engage the entire body, combining aspects of energetic vinyasa flow, relaxing yin yoga, breathing practice and meditation Practice self-care Experience the outrageously beautiful transient NOW: breathe, dance, flow 
 
Full description: This workshop is based on a series that I have developed while working with a variety of bodies over the past 4 years: the Luminosity Flow The name reflects the brightness we all have within us, and the ways in which festival culture creates a space in which we feel empowered to shine and share the gift of our own unique self with the world around us It is my intention that this flow will help your body feel bright, balanced and ready to play 
Weï¿½ï¿½ll begin with pranayama breathing practice to create a space of grounded awareness and full breath From there we'll build to a powerful vinyasa flow, engaging muscular strength and willpower to create heat and energy in the body, After a powerful and dynamic peak, the flow will gradually melt into a floor series, in which we'll practice yin restorative yoga - deep stretching that gets into the fascia and connective tissue of the body Weï¿½ï¿½ll engage and stretch from root to crown, from skin to spine, leaving no stone unturned Closing with a juicy body-awareness meditation, this class is designed to provide a space for self-care so that you can get the most out of your festival experience 
Enjoy the privilege of your ALIVENESS 
Explore the conjunction of space, matter, gravity, body, light, language, consciousness 
Experience present-ness Be in your body: breathe, dance, flow 

Teacher Bio: 
Lauren DeGaine
I recieved my BA degree in Yoga Teacher Training from Naropa University Led by Nataraja Kallio, it is the only undergraduate degree program in yoga in the United States The 3-year training explored anatomy, theory, philosophy, history and origins, physiology, therapeutics, the chakras and more My teaching philosophy revolves around well-being: yoga works with the body, but engages the mind and the emotions as well Yoga asks how can we use our practice to engage with the world as our most authentic self 

Often using the chakra system as a lens, my classes emphasize resetting the nervous system, developing body awareness, balancing the masculine and feminine energies and working towards a sustained experience of well-being Yoga is exercise, but it can also be a process which gradually transmutes discordant energies in the body toward a state of joy and heightened awareness

This winter I have had the privilege of debuting a handcrafted class, Sexy Restorative Flow, at Amethyst Dance and Fitness studio in Victoria, BC The inspiration from this class came from a desire to combine exercise with restoration, and to indulge my love of deep, sexy bass music This class gave me the opportunity to formulate and share the Luminosity Flow and the Warrior Goddess Flow Iï¿½ï¿½m excited to bring these sequences to festivals this summer

Honest Non Monogamy 101: a 1 1/2 hr workshop

Open relationships? Polyamory? Relationship Anarchy? For many people, ethical and honest non monogamy is about freedom: freedom to love who you want, when you want, in whatever way feels authentic between adults and is mutually consensual It has a rosy reputation for being about not putting limitations on whom or how you love, being able to acknowledge your needs and desires and dreams, knowing that to expect one person alone to fulfill all of them is way too much pressure 

But what's the reality? How do the myths differ from the practical applications? How does it actually work in real life? Is non monogamy some enlightened approach to living, or simply another set of options for relating to other humans? Is there a Golden Path to polyamorous perfection, or is it a multilinear dance where we each get to decide what works for us as individuals? 

Whether honest non-monogamy is new to you, or you have years of experience, this workshop promises to offer fresh and insightful perspectives, and empower you with new tools to assist you in enjoying more fulfilling relationships!

Greetings! 

My practice comes in the form of a device called a Pineal Activation Light The Light uses an array of LED lights, which are set to strobe at frequencies which correlate with powerful healing, and meditative states It does so by stimulating the pineal gland, causing a release of endogenous tryptamines, which in turn, bring uses into states similar to those experienced with entheogens They are used primarily in healing centers, float houses, yoga schools, and therapeutic practices, but I have managed to successfully implement the light at various festivals/events, with a fully portable set up The light is a unique representation of spirit, and technology, much like the festivals I have attending with it 

To run my practice, I will set up a space in which participants -- individuals and small groups -- would be able to relax an ground themselves, and experience the effects of the light This would be done in a quiet spot, amidst other healers, or nestled away in a quiet patch of art If I am able to manage the logistics of transporting an 8x8 copper pyramid frame, it shall be set up under that

As I have to operate the device, will be guiding participants through the whole experience, answering questions, setting the tone, providing music via noise canceling headphones, and burning all sorts of delicious smelling items This space shall be held for a few hours a day, toward dusk, when the light is most effective

I would be honored to be a part of this gathering, and am looking forward to hearing back from you!

Blessings to you!

Joshua

Greetings!  This an updated version of the talk I gave last year at Blessed Coast, this time with a year's experience in the new story of love and actionable principles for conscious relating for festival goers   This workshop has been successfully delivered at Rainbow Serpent & Earth Frequency Australia, and Envision Costa Rica   

HEALING OF LOVE: Sex, Partnership and the Village
Duration: 90 minutes
Tech requirements: none

Many are beginning to question the current story of love: the belief that we must find "THE ONE": a partner who will grant our happiness and fulfill all our needs And yet, with growing divorce rates, betrayal, and stressed partnerships, the old story isn't working for many Others are experimenting with various models of open relationship and alternative forms - some finding joy but also much heartache 

New paradigm filmmaker Ian MacKenzie and co-facilitator Mya Hardman aka AppleCat speak about the research from Tamera peace village in Portugal, exploring the foundations the new story in love and sexuality How might we cultivate communities of trust to support the freedom to love without fear? 

Whatever your relationship form, monogamy, polyamory or beyond, this workshop will explore the role of the community in healthy partnership

Watch a preview
http://wwwianmackcom/videos/healing-love/

Title: Conscious Connected Breathwork
Time: 15 hours could be an hour if needed also willing to do a couple of workshops 
I would need a sound system, there would be limited space in the workshop about 15 people also would need a space like a wall tent or a space with walls/far away from lots of people walking by/some sort of separation My partner Dalton would be assisting me in facilitating

Conscious breathing allows your unconscious to open and release repressed emotions Connecting and opening our breath we are able to become present, raising our energy to feel a higher vibration, getting unstuck from old emotions Opening our heart with each breath to be able to feel all that we are feeling without vulnerability, making room for spirit and authenticity 

To sum up a breath workshop: We would start with a share circle to create a safe and sacred space for everyone Then we would start a breath activation to get our energy flowing and breathing a bit heavier Next we would start the breath session by lying down and staying in a conscious breath for an hour with myself and my partner their to support and do a bit of hands on facilitation to help get the oxygen flowing through the whole body To end we would have another share circle for people that want to share there experience and to talk to myself or Dalton for any addition support or grounding that is needed

"The Shadow Side of Polyamory"

Open relationships can offer sexual fulfilment, joy and satisfaction- yet there is a Shadow side, and left unexamined, people can get hurt  Still, Polyamory can potentially offer a profound path of self development In this interactive presentation, weï¿½ï¿½ll be courageously exploring this shadow side to Polyamory, and more

The Middle Pillar Exercise and Robert Anton Wilson's Ungrounding: Western Hermetic Yoga and Using It to Gain a Universal Perspective

This is a fast paced presentation about The Hermetic Qabala, Ceremonial Magic, and The Qabalistic Tree of Life I describe how the Qabalistic Tree of Life equates to the Hindu Chakras Participants are guided through a creative visualization meditation and breathing exercise, which is effective in raising anyoneï¿½ï¿½s level of awareness, mindfulness, energy, and mood We will fire up our chakras The Middle Pillar Exercise is an essential component to Ceremonial Magic and the Western Mysteries Its impact upon individuals working with it is very similar to Kundalini Yoga
We then move into a guided visualization meditation, which provides participants with a fresh and fun cosmic perspective of their life on Earth in this space/time matrix Robert Antone Wilson created this exercise and imparted it to me in a workshop in 1999 He is an author and modern philosopher, who may be best known for books, such as, ï¿½ï¿½The Illuminati Trilogyï¿½ï¿½, ï¿½ï¿½Prometheus Risingï¿½ï¿½, and the ï¿½ï¿½Cosmic Triggerï¿½ï¿½ 
Don't be shy, come and try magic that works Please be on time This workshop will take about an hour and a half Admission will be closed when the meditation process begins

"The Spiral Dance: a Wiccan Celebration of Life and Community"

The Spiral, an ancient symbol connecting our present day with our ancient spiritual roots: a
continuum that signifies the movement of energy It is this mind set of positive energy to
promote positive results that is danced into our existence
With the help of the help of the Goddess, and the powers of nature we weave our magick into action to support healing of our Great Mother Earth
Through the Spiral Dance we are provided the opportunity to connect to one another, and along with the momentum of the dance, we are propelled slowly inward, toward reflection,  turning to express and expand outward only when we have turned that small corner in the centre The Spiral Dance is conducted as a significant portion of a basic Wiccan Circle where the stated intention is to bring healing and respect to our relationship with Nature and the Earth, and to share in a celebration of community This involves the creation of the circle, the calling and establishment of the 4 quarters, elements, and directions, the statement of intention, the raising of energy through the spiral dance, chanting and drumming, the blessing, and the conclusion 

This is an all ages or family friendly activity We can conduct it with a dozen to a couple hundred people

Conscious Dance Playshop 

Hi- I'm Tammra and I have been a dj for 15+ years and a holistic health certified master practitioner since 2006, although my journey with holistic nutrition started 20+ years ago 

I am presently studying 5Rhythms Dance - which will likely take at least another 3 years to complete but in the meantime I run Conscious Dance Playshops I am also the FoundHer of The Conscious Goddess Festival A festival of workshops mostly 

The Playshop really depends on the audience - but typically I dj for 15 hours and some events are 3 hours or more and I journey through a multitude of genres including but not limited to healing tones, meditation music, native, edm, glitch hop, funk, house, psychedelic, progressive, dnb and more I choose songs based on intuition at the event I eventually come to stillness and offer a hypnotic integration I guide people through exploring the maps of their body and emotions and use my skills as a master NLP and Hypnosis Practitioner to build trust and speak with the subconscious mind I don't speak a lot I also may sing a note or a mantra I can also add in my 505 groovebox for added elements of sound I mix in key, beatmatch, layer etc all of the music live I can add samples, poetry, spoken word and powerful readings to the playshop, again, if that is what I am feeling from the audience - it's about them / us

I do offer space to journal or have discussion if the space is small If this is a main-stage event - I may not be able to do that I am open

ï¿½ï¿½I love movement and the freedom I feel when my brain turns off and my body flows of its own accord Yoga moves me, lifts my spirits, calms my mind and makes me feel connected I appreciate how yoga has deepened my awareness of how to move my body and engage my muscles It reminds me to breathe, keeps my mind free of stress and worry and allows my body to relax

Hello :

We are offering a 15 hour workshop centred in Mindful Self-Compassion through Expressive Arts Therapy 

The workshop begins with a guided meditation to enter the inner experience and cultivate the energy of compassion and concentrated awareness With this awareness and compassion present the participants are guided into creatively expressing their unique inner world through visual art The participants are encouraged and facilitated in nourishing self-compassion and non-judgmental perspective to their artworks, hearts and minds Then the participants are shown how to communicate with their own artwork and how this technique offers a vehicle for embracing ourselves In closing the artists are asked to share if they are comfortable what their inner world guided them to express as well as sharing their artwork A small closing loving-kindness mediation is guided and the workshop ends

Diana and I are both studying Expressive Arts Therapy at Langara College and we are fusing this practice with our meditation practice in hopes to offer a safe vehicle for self-compassion and the freedom of self-expression

Vibrational Source :: Sound Healing & Connecting to Energetic Reality

The use of sound as a healing force is one of the most ancient human practices of medicine which is being rediscovered with profound implications in our modern era The ancients often used sound and music to treat the essence of the human being, the soul itself, as the finer energies of vibration are able to relate and connect to our deeper aspects This is also seen as getting to the very root of much dis-ease Beyond its healing applications, the whole paradigm of sound healing opens a new horizon of engaging an energetic sense of reality and particularly in connecting to the vibrational intelligence of the Heart This is literally a re-enchantment of the world, as our perception shifts to feeling our way through life, garnering union with the guiding wisdom of the universe and its subtle intuitive powers As we come to realize our source as vibrational entities, it changes the whole way we live, giving us new skills of empowerment to foster lives of evolving potential Using the voice as a healing tool emboldens this vibrational sensibility Participants will learn simple ways to use the voice as a sound healing instrument to transform energy blockages in our being, enthuse intention, transform our moods and how to utilize sound in groups to foster powerful unifying space Participants will be introduced to the use of sound and music as medicine drawing from the wisdom of the ancients and modern innovations The workshop will conclude with a mystical performance of the crystal singing bowls and a group chant for world peace

Hello,

My given name is Kat Bickert but the name given to me by my guru is Maa Karuna Ananda, meaning Mother of compassionate Bliss

I would be teaching way for visionaries to deepen connection to what I call their "Cosmic Essence" through simple practices like ceremony, prayer, meditation and yoga I will teach the 8-Limb Formula to Cosmic Bliss Samadhi as passed down in the Ashtanga Yoga tradition from Rishi Patanjali in the yoga Sutras, explain an 8-step process to deepen connection & power to manifest vision through prayer, and the importance of mastering basic foundational yoga postures 

I will end the workshop by guiding in a special pranayama passed down to me by my guru that instantly deepens meditation and guide students through a body awareness meditation 

I mainly focus on teaching visionaries because those who have the vision for peace, harmony and abundance on earth, are the ones often working towards that end The issue is that many of us visionaries are up in the clouds with our big beautiful vision, yet our lives are lived incongruently to this vision in some way A large factor is that when someone with a great power of vision hasn't deeply grounded themselves in the physical world before performing their work, their actions have a large potential energy left untapped

By teaching visionaries the power of simple but deep grounding practices, their level of presence and awareness increases and the power to manifest their vision through their daily actions increases Through tapping into the internal reservoir of the Cosmic Sense of Self we awaken our Divine power and restore peace and balance

Hello Blessed Blessed Folks!

My name is Cody Wicks and I am writing to offer and open to teaching and facilitating at Blessed Coast this year I am currently doing communications, outreach, and event coordination at OUR Ecovillage in Shawnigan Lake One of my major projects here is creating the EDE Ecovillage Design Education program here, an extension to the Permaculture Design Certificate I have my Permaculture Teacher's Training by Cascadia Permaculture Institute, a certificate in Sustainable Community Development at SFU, a background in toxicology, and a lot of experience in social enterprise creation, crowdfunding, and consensus building!

I would love to do one of a few workshops If there is any interest in any of the following, please let me know and I will reply with a full description:

1 Intro to Permaculture - Working in whole-systems design, we can create and hold space in a way that is in alignment with what is Rather than asserting our will on the landscape, we can work with the landscape to create a holistic and easy way of life While supporting indigenous sovereignty, local plants and animals, we can integrate the 12+ permaculture principles into our life and our projects in all aspects 

2 Intro to Dynamic Governance consensus - Consensus works! We can empower ourselves and our communities by working in consensus to create the decisions without pushing an agenda on anyone We can use circles and mutual respect to create an intention for collaboration, while moving forward decisions quickly and in alignment

3 The Mutualism Hub - Social enterprise networking! Let's share what we do in circle, what we have to offer in abundance, and what we are looking for assistance with If we come from a place of service to Mother Earth, we can manifest in an ethical way! 

4 Ecovillages as Living Conscious Community Centres - What are ecovillages and intentional communities really doing? They are holding space to innovate on all levels of society, from the local community within the village, to the surrounding community, to the global peace pilgrammage currently occuring We are coming together as a species and beings around the planet to create a new story that is based on peace, acceptance, love, trust, and true justice Ecovillages are the sanctuary and consciousness hubs that are anchoring this space for us to connect and create the future we want

Symmetry Art - an art of letting go

Time speaks to us through our bodies and our observation of the natural world Our fascination with documenting our story has lead to intricate calendars and time keeping practices Cultures around the globe in many different eras have charted, logged and documented time in diverse ways to mark our celebration times and honor what is of value to the culture Our current mainstream culture can be observed as monotone within its linear time scape with little to no nuances reflecting our varied seasonal experience or giving rise to the eternal   This system does not honor our true cyclical nature or give permission to our capacity to respond to observation This workshop will give insight into a few different time keeping practices that have been documented, with a glance into Lunarsolar calendars that give credence to both of our most present cosmic bodies/ symbolic time keepers in the sky, Sun and moon  We will also look into how all of the zodiac signs reflect the time of year that they are placed in, showing the first astrologers used there observation of the natural environment around and within them to make sense of what was going on within and without We will look at how a functioning Lunarsolar calendar can work today based on the sun and moon and zodiac signs in dynamic harmony As we explore our connection to our environment, we will dive into some exercises that invite us to explore our own capacity for observation We are the present moment, the newness of this time is experienced through our faculties of perception, we are sacred timekeepers What is the cosmos/ natural world communicating with us, through our senses? Can we tap into the natural world to reveal the mysteries of light and the shadow, what is at play? Can we hear the moments that invite us to pause long enough to catch the next wave? Can we harmonize with our surroundings?  If we are in tune with our environment, the planet, astral bodies, and our being can we empower ourselves through harmony to create a paradigm that supports and honors life?  We will reflect upon our harmony and balance within our ecosystem, as possible pathways for greater inner peace  Many of us are already living in a closer connection to the rhythmic nature of the natural world This workshop will give language to and empower our capacity for healthy shifts by being that which is true to our hearts  As the workshop draws to a close an assignment will be designated to participants to adventure into the natural environment and have a conversation with there surroundings, tools, tips and guidance will be offered for this exercise The exercise is a medium for raising our capacity to have a thriving relationship with the natural world and developing our capacity to harmonize and create from this place of connection Time is not a force we must work against rather a reflection that can serve us in harmonizing our intentions and actions with the great cosmic symphony of existence

Blessed Coast: The Permaculture Experience

Ideally this workshop will be held right at the beginning of the gathering!

I will facilitate a workshop that spans the entire time of Blessed Coast by holding space for a self-directed Intro to Permaculture over the course of this gathering Weaving together with any other permaculture workshops offered, there would be three major parts:

1 The workshop: At the beginning of the festival, or part-way through, I would do a 1-3 hour workshop on permaculture We would go over the principles and the Permaculture Game would begin

2 The Permaculture Game: Find others throughout the course of the festival and connect around permaculture Discuss the principles based on the initial workshop, and write down any notes, important quotes, journal entries, or any other way to share our stories around permaculture at Blessed Coast

3 After the Gathering: Participants will have the option to complete a review of their experience and send it in to receive a Certificate that they have completed the Intro to Permaculture and played the Permaculture Game at Blessed Coast over their 72 hours there It will include questions written or drawn answers, a Facebook group for discussion, chance to submit designs for Blessed Coast and other gatherings to consider, and give links to resources and books that can help in their permaculture journey 

This is a great way to connect diverse people around permaculture It doesn't compete with any other permaculture workshops but is only improved by them, as people have a chance to play with and engage in their knowledge It gives them a certificate that they can then use to move into other areas of permaculture from a place of knowledge

We aim to inform, inspire, and energize each other to move through life in a way that is not only sustainable, but is regenerative FOR THE GOOD OF ALL LIVING BEINGS!

Title of workshop:
"Sustainability for millennial's"

Introduction: 
This is about a 30-45 minute group workshop that will help to inform and educate our current generation on how to design anything in a sustainable frame of mind Weather it be physical products, art, music, fashion, or even if you want to make your daily life more sustainable, this is the catalyst to get the natural reaction going!

Outline: There will be a short introduction of myself and background, followed by a group exercise involving participants and getting them thinking in the right state of mind! We will then dive into the main focus of the workshop, 2 case studies The first is a look at the declining industry of physical print design vs against the ever growing digital graphic design industry This will lay out what some people already know about sustainability, which is the environmental part But in the next case study, the story of a sustainable restaurant in Vancouver BC that is striving to stay above water in tough times while battling against the corporate chains that just feed on profits This topic will help to grow everyones understanding of what it means to be "sustainable", over catch phrases like "going green, or being environmental/social conscious" This will cover most of the lecture, if there are not too many questions throughout this period and time is going well, another case study or example will be presented to further expand upon the subject From there we will participate in a second group exercise where we come up with ideas in small groups of products of ideas we can make more sustainable using the information we just learned There will be a short conclusion and information given on where to find out more, and time for final questions at the end


Some of the key notes addressed will be:
-The definition of sustainability, ï¿½ï¿½Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needsï¿½ï¿½
-The three pillars of sustainability: enivronmentally sound economically viable, and socially just
-The principles of sustainable design: learning from natural systems, respect for energy/resources, respect for people, respect for place, respect for future, and systems thinking
-practical steps designers can take to make a difference: design for use, dematerialization, design for disassembly, substution, localization, transmaterialization, design for durability, design for reuse unintended & intended, and redesigning the system 
-Setting up sustainable framework, ie: LCAlife cycle assessment, The Green table Network, Oceanwise certification, making your own DIY

We are in a period of emergence We are letting go of control and hierarchy, and allowing, surrendering, to what is wanting to come through us What is wanting to emerge 

We can connect with and honour ourselves and through this, connect with and honour others 

I would love to hold an emergence circle and workshop for Blessed Coast Of course, this nessesarily means allowing for what wants to emerge in the circle 

Most commonly, this will go in two general directions:

Inwards: I-circle inside ourselves, we will share what is going on for us, and our reflections and mirrors will share what this brings up for them in what they are going through, and so-on This is a sign that we as a group have healing to do together in the interior of our souls Our karma Our conditioning Our memories It can be seen in many lights, through  many stories In a safe space, we can go inside

Outwards: O-circle will usually start with an I-circle round, where we go inwards and find that what we want is to look outwards To see what we can manifest We may share our dreams, passions, loves, ideas, visions It will be facilitated in such a way that what wants to emerge will emerge In one workshop, we ended up self-organizing into 4 groups to brainstorm and create 4 crowdfunding campaigns for those that really had a fire going to manifest their passions in that moment Other times, we may do rounds and share what we are all creating, and leave space to connect afterwards and self-select into long-term relationships of manifestation 

It can take any shape, always for the highest good, into ourselves and into the universe around us Humanity is at an inflection point, where we move into the 'yellow' or 'teal' areas of spiral dynamics, seeing the full power of our collective experience, stories, and will And integrating it We are moving into a complex ecosystem where it is impossible to map ahead of time what is emerging, yet we can see patterns and work with what is 

This is also an intro to social permaculture workshop that will draw heavily on the permaculture principles

The problem is the solution: If a problem comes up, we will crowd source a solution through our collective spirit 

Respect and honour diversity: Any group that comes together is unique, and if we get away from our assumptions and expectations, this particular group can create something as unique as it is Something that could resonate through the planet in a wave and ripple of peace

Produce no waste: Everything we hear is a mirror in which to see our own consciousness As Alan Watts says, "The eye can see, but it cannot see itself" 

Use Edges and Value the Marginal: Will we see our edges as exciting areas of innovation, growth, and challenge Or will we see them as triggering and stress? I will hold space to go into whatever arises and value the marginal areas of our current consciousness as we expand together 

Observe and Interact: Through observation of ourselves, our triggers, our interests, our connections, our reflections, our mirrors, we can see and interact with the world in a way we otherwise cannot Together we are strong

Creatively Use and Respond to Change: I have no idea what will come up in this group Even if I did, things may change with no notice As a group, and as individuals, we can creatively use and respond to changes in the way this group comes together to find what spirit is trying to say through us 

Catch and Store Energy: What energy is coming with us? What is trying to emerge? It can be anything! What ever energy comes up, we will catch and store in quantum manifestation If we can hold energy into a solid space, it will be able to move through the system in a way that we want with intention 

Apply Self-regulation and Apply Feedback: As self-aware individuals, we can look inside and apply self-regulation and accept and apply feedback from those around us If the space is held safely and with intention, self-responsibility, and with love, we can use all reactions and responses to create a better world for ourselves and those around us 

Design From Patterns to Details: We can see the patterns in ourselves and those around us, we can see patterns in nature that indicate ways that we can move for a more sustainable and loving future Whether looking inwards or outwards, patterns can indicate the stories we need to listen to 

Integrate Rather Than Segregate: Sometimes we have a group with seemingly conflicting ideas, or rather stories, that come up This can be the greatest gift, if we are brave enough to stand and hold space for it We can find the overlap between even the most seemingly diverse set of stories, and show our common humanity and goals for peace and love on earth We all want to belong, let's be the change 

Use and Value Renewnable Resources and Services: Almost enough said there If we are creating and showing up from our highest good, from our passionate centre, we can channel from spirit and renew ourselves and the planet around us 

Use Small and Slow Solutions: Sometimes, taking the time to go around the circle is the most healing and innovative thing to do Giving each person a chance to hear and reflect on what their mirrors are showing them can be a huge gift Small and slow, we will create a new world outside of the time paradigm 



There are many ways this can go I am very open to doing a short workshop over a few hours as I am to having a space that we hold space for this throughout the entire festival This is my passion and journey in life and there would be nothing that brings me more joy than to bring an emergence point into Blessed Coast 

Much love,

Cody Wicks

Playshop Title: Loving Yourself Infinitely, Loving Your Infinite Self  
 
Description: 

Wake up to the inspiration of the day Welcome presence, love, trust and gratitude to your mat Connect to the inner and outer elements and nature We combine Hatha Yoga with exploration, creativity, intention and sacred knowledge Physical postures, breathing techniques, sounding, and writing are used to awaken the body, still the mind, increase range of motion, let go of tension, play and be present in the moment This wondrous journey connects to the source of infinite self-love All are welcome

Title: Women's Circle Celebrating Divine Sexuality 

Gather with an intimate group of women to share and explore the deep mysteries of female sexuality Enjoying and reclaiming your sexuality is a birthright Through various practices of movement, art, ritual and reflection, we will discover and awaken to our feminine sexual essence 
From this place, we connect deeply to all of life and open to the bliss, power and wisdom of yoni and heart This will be held in a safe space of love Please arrive in time and wear comfortable clothing

Stillness Through Movement
An exploration into Vinyasa Flow and Traditional Ashtanga Yoga Bringing together focus of the mind, the eyes, the senses, the breath and the body, leading us towards finding stillness through movement 
Stillness and a subtlety can be found in strong and dynamic asanas as well as gentle, restorative asanas In this workshop, all will be explored and we will journey towards discovering our seat and our stillness in our asana practice

Life Upside Down
In this workshop, we will explore grounding standing asanas, balancing sequences and playful inversions As we root down, find strength in our foundation and create a sense of ease upside down, we prepare to face life's challenges and be open to receiving the complexities of life that come our way 
Here, we discover that Yoga is not something we do in life, Yoga becomes the groundwork for how we live our life Here, we will find balance as we stand tall and create confidence as we turn ourselves upside down

Awakening the Senses Healing Dance and movement

For me, dance is a true expression of our souls and also showing us our physical and mental blockages The way we move and are moved by Life is showing us a clear mirror of ourselves and can deeply contribute to our evolution  In this always accelerating world we are living in, dance is a powerful tool to clear the mind and come back to our senses Offering a dance floor where we can get out of the box, re-connect with our body/spirit and transcend the fears is one of the purpose of my offerings  In doing so, we are opening ourselves to the divine/sensual aspect of ourselves and taping in our healing power By creating a balance between guidance and free dancing, we enter in a sacred space where we can receive, share and grow

This offering is a journey where we let go of the mind and come back to embodying the Goddess/God that we are We open our bodies to the ï¿½ï¿½juicyï¿½ï¿½ aspect of Life, giving ourselves permission to move exactly the way we want to, the way it feels good for us! Integrating sensuality, letting go of the fear and coming back to beauty of the senses which are a doorway towards connecting with the divine

Here is a link for the last workshop i offered at the ''Conscious Goddess Festival'' at the same location a few weeks ago  You can find testimonials and more: http://theconsciousgoddessfestivalcom/#9946ef84-42bb-cl

I will co-facilitate this workshop with my partner James Thomas

The Sacred Sharing Circle is a transformational process, in which participants are guided to share within a safe and open space their current external/internal challenges that are arising in life and/or within the festival experience in order to open up and receive the gifts/teachings which life itself are providing us with

In the end participants not only have the opportunity to strengthen their connection with and learn from one another, but also have a chance to re-connect with the teachings of the Medicine wheel and become better equipped to carry with them this practical tool of the sharing circle which, can then be utilized in our own communities and homes in order to assist with our ability to honour our relationships with ourselves, others and all that exists and transform our lives

"As a couple we have seen first hand within our own relationship, and with our two boys the importance and value of the sharing circle - which is the main reason why we travel the country sharing this tool within homes and schools  Recognizing it may be the most essential tool for us to utilize in order to re-connect with one another by creating the space to openly communicate our emotions in a safe, respectful way  Allowing us to gain a mutual understanding for one another while being able to practice the essential skills of expressing our emotions, being present/able to listen to one another, and recognize that we do in fact have the ability to process anything and everything we face in life - especially when we are able to do it together"

Dear Blessed Coast,
I would love the opportunity to offer poi spinning workshops at your festival! For anyone that doesn't know, poi spinning can be considered a circus flow art and involves spinning weighted balls on the end of strings, usually one in each hand Poi spinning originated as a Maori tradition to improve warriors wrist/arm flexibility and dexterity, and has now developed into a performance art, with fire performance and urban street circus being two major forms
I have personally been spinning poi for two years now, having performed with both fire and LED poi at various events, including the Whistler Blackcomb Fire and Ice shows I have also spent many hours teaching poi to various people including friends and more formal arrangements I can offer instruction right from complete beginner moves up to advanced techniques, performance considerations and improving general flow In terms of workshops I am happy to offer multiple workshops at different standards or just adapt to the class based on demand
I am an avid yoga enthusiast and mostly follow the Ashtanga practice although I have enjoyed many Iyengar and Hatha classes I would love the opportunity to be a part of and contribute to this event as I feel that is the best way to experience festivals
I hope you can consider my application, I look forward to hearing back from you!
Peace, love and my warmest regards,
Samuel Scott
